pluggable.name: Macca's Ravelry
pluggable.author: Katy Ereira
pluggable.description: Ravelry progress bars for knitting and crochet projects.

help.value:
Configuration

Activate and configure the plugin with your username and Ravelry API key - you can find your key at http://www.ravelry.com/help/api

Please make sure you use the correct key and username - they are a unique pair.

Usage

There is a Ravelry block available for use in your theme's sidebar. Go to themes in the Habari menu and add a block of type 'Macca's Ravelry', configure the settings, then add it to your sidebars.

Alternatively, you can use the following code anywhere in your theme to display output with your default configuration options:

<?php $theme->m_ravelry(); ?>

Customisation

You may wish to customise the look of the progress bars. You can edit the HTML in the m_ravelry.php file, and the CSS in the m_ravelry.css file. Important parts of the CSS are commented for you.

You can also replace the default placeholder image by over-writing the image file, or by changing the placeholder URL in the m_ravelry.php file.
